page.title: 04 Hedgerows
page.content: The hedge in Cornwall is a very well known feature.During the winter time, as the winds and rain sweep across the countryside the sheep are not the only ones to be grateful for their shelter. * * * * * * * As the lambs arrive,heralding the coming of Spring, the first growth appears.Daffodils,usually near habitation,are followed by primroses. In May and June,the jungle season, what were narrow country lanes now seem barely penetrable.A kaleidoscope of changing colour is dominated by cow parsley and campion. The noisy hedge trimmer comes to cut back-to make safe.Has it arrived late enough to allow for next year's profusion?Will the hedge continue to confer its protection over its inhabitants?
